intro: Oldenlandia lechleriana, commonly known as the "Cape jasmine," is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, small white flowers that bloom in clusters, often resembling jasmine. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and typically elliptical in shape. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along stream banks.
